task.title: Installing Open Dylan on Win32 Systems

step.cmd: Obtain a copy of the Open Dylan self-extracting installer from the Open Dylan website, or from an installation CD.
Run the installer by double-clicking on the installer icon.

stepresult.p: The installer opening banner will appear.

step.cmd: Click Next to proceed to the License Agreement page.
Click I Agree to proceed to the Choose Components page.
Choose the installation options and components you want (or do nothing to use the default values) and click Next to proceed to the Choose Install Location page.
Choose an installation folder (or do nothing to use the default location) and click Next to proceed to the External Build System page.
Choose which external build system you will be using and click Install to proceed.
step.info: Open Dylan is capable of generating native code object files on its own. However, in order to link these object files into a Windows executable program or DLL, it is necessary for it to invoke an external linker (and, if the Dylan project requires it, an external C compiler or resource file compiler). You will need to have at least one of these linkers installed in order to build a Dylan library project. After installation you will be able to choose a different build system.

step.cmd: Wait for the installer to copy all of the necessary files and display the Completing... page.
Click Finish to exit the installer.
